title: Trump Names Lebanese-American Massad Boulos As Middle-East Advisor
content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Sunday named Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior advisor on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs, the latest family member to be appointed to a key position.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump on Sunday named Lebanese-American businessman Massad Boulos as his senior advisor on Arab and Middle Eastern affairs, the latest family member to be appointed to a key position.

title: Zelensky Seeks NATO Security Guarantees, Weapons Before Russia Talks
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that his country needed security guarantees from NATO and more weapons to defend itself before any talks with Russia.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Sunday that his country needed security guarantees from NATO and more weapons to defend itself before any talks with Russia.

title: US Rules Out Returning Nuclear Weapons To Ukraine, Says Jake Sullivan
content: The United States is not considering returning to Ukraine the nuclear weapons it gave up after the Soviet Union collapsed, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Sunday.
summary: The United States is not considering returning to Ukraine the nuclear weapons it gave up after the Soviet Union collapsed, White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Sunday.

title: Gaza Ceasefire And Hostage Deal  "Not There Yet", Says White House
content: The White House is working on a ceasefire and hostage release deal in Gaza but is "not there yet," the US National Security Advisor told NBC on Sunday, with fighting in the conflict raging on as regional leaders meet to discuss the crisis.
summary: The White House is working on a ceasefire and hostage release deal in Gaza but is "not there yet," the US National Security Advisor told NBC on Sunday, with fighting in the conflict raging on as regional leaders meet to discuss the crisis.

title: Bangladesh Court Acquits All In 2004 Attack On Sheikh Hasina's Rally Case
content: Bengaldesh High Court on Sunday acquitted all accused, including former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia's son Tarique Rahman and former state minister Lutfozzaman Babar, in a 2004 grenade attack in ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's rally.
summary: Bengaldesh High Court on Sunday acquitted all accused, including former Bangladesh prime minister Khaleda Zia's son Tarique Rahman and former state minister Lutfozzaman Babar, in a 2004 grenade attack in ousted premier Sheikh Hasina's rally.

title: British Man Dies In Lift Shaft During Holiday In Turkey, Family Seeks Probe
content: His family is devastated and seeking a thorough investigation into the circumstances of his death, which remain unclear.
summary: His family is devastated and seeking a thorough investigation into the circumstances of his death, which remain unclear.

title: Georgian PM Praises Police For Crackdown Of Protests Over Halt Of EU Talks
content: Facing condemnation from the United States and defiance from his own president, Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze praised police on Sunday for cracking down on protesters who he said were acting on foreign orders to undermine the state.
summary: Facing condemnation from the United States and defiance from his own president, Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze praised police on Sunday for cracking down on protesters who he said were acting on foreign orders to undermine the state.

title: Japan To Prosecute Dead Teen Whose Suicide Attempt Killed A Woman
content: Many argued that pursuing charges against the dead teenager is unnecessary and a misallocation of resources, as it serves no practical purpose.
summary: Many argued that pursuing charges against the dead teenager is unnecessary and a misallocation of resources, as it serves no practical purpose.

title: 2 More ISKCON Devotees "Missing" In Bangladesh After Hindu Priest's Arrest
content: A day after the second Hindu monk, Shyam Das Prabhu, was arrested in Bangladesh, two other disciples of arrested spiritual leader Chinmoy Krishna Das have also gone missing in Chattogram, ISKCON Kolkata spokesperson Radharamn Das claimed on Saturday.
summary: A day after the second Hindu monk, Shyam Das Prabhu, was arrested in Bangladesh, two other disciples of arrested spiritual leader Chinmoy Krishna Das have also gone missing in Chattogram, ISKCON Kolkata spokesperson Radharamn Das claimed on Saturday.

title: Ellen DeGeneres's New UK Home Flooded Weeks After Relocating From US
content: The couple moved to Cotswolds, a rural area in south central England after listing their massive Montecito Estate north of Los Angeles.
summary: The couple moved to Cotswolds, a rural area in south central England after listing their massive Montecito Estate north of Los Angeles.

title: Netizens Puzzled As Bug Stops ChatGPT From Saying 'David Mayer'
content: ChatGPT, the popular chatbot of Microsoft-backed artificial intelligence (AI) startup OpenAI, seems to be facing a bug, preventing it from producing any results related to the name "David Mayer".
summary: ChatGPT, the popular chatbot of Microsoft-backed artificial intelligence (AI) startup OpenAI, seems to be facing a bug, preventing it from producing any results related to the name "David Mayer".

title: This Country Brings Law Granting Maternity Leave, Pensions To Sex Workers
content: Belgium has come up with a new law, the first of its kind in the world, recognising the rights of sex workers and offering them treatment like any other job.
summary: Belgium has come up with a new law, the first of its kind in the world, recognising the rights of sex workers and offering them treatment like any other job.

title: Fact Check: Did Hindu Monk Chinmoy Das Assault Woman In Bangladesh?
content: Chinmoy Krishna Das, a Vaishnavite leader and former member of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) in Bangladesh, was arrested by the Dhaka Metropolitan Police on charges of sedition.
summary: Chinmoy Krishna Das, a Vaishnavite leader and former member of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) in Bangladesh, was arrested by the Dhaka Metropolitan Police on charges of sedition.

title: Bashar Al-Assad: Syria's Unyielding Leader In The Face Of Decade-Long Chaos
content: For over a decade, the Bashar al-Assad regime in Syria seemed to have weathered the storm of a brutal civil war with help from powerful allies like Russia and Iran.
summary: For over a decade, the Bashar al-Assad regime in Syria seemed to have weathered the storm of a brutal civil war with help from powerful allies like Russia and Iran.

title: All About Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, The Rebels Seizing Control Of Aleppo
content: Hayat Tahrir al-Sham emerged from al-Qaeda-affiliated Jabhat al-Nusra during the Syrian civil war.

title: 12 Killed As Thailand And Malaysia Face Worst Floods In Decades
content: The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand and northern Malaysia climbed to at least 12 on Saturday, authorities said, as tens of thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels in the past three days.
summary: The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand and northern Malaysia climbed to at least 12 on Saturday, authorities said, as tens of thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels in the past three days.

title: Over 300 Killed As Syrian Rebels Sweep Into Aleppo, Russia Supports Assad
content: The Syrian army has said dozens of its soldiers had been killed in a major attack led by Islamist Hayat Tahrir al-Sham rebels who swept into the city of Aleppo, forcing army to redeploy in the biggest challenge to President Bashar al-Assad in years.
summary: The Syrian army has said dozens of its soldiers had been killed in a major attack led by Islamist Hayat Tahrir al-Sham rebels who swept into the city of Aleppo, forcing army to redeploy in the biggest challenge to President Bashar al-Assad in years.

title: "Trying To Make Bangladesh Part Of India": Woman Journalist Mobbed In Dhaka
content: A mob surrounded senior Bangladesh journalist Munni Saha in Dhaka last night and accused her of spreading misinformation and "doing everything to make Bangladesh a part of India".
summary: A mob surrounded senior Bangladesh journalist Munni Saha in Dhaka last night and accused her of spreading misinformation and "doing everything to make Bangladesh a part of India".

title: 'Khalistani' Terrorist Gets Bail In Canada Amid India's Push ForExtradition
content: A Canadian court has granted bail to Khalistani terrorist Arshdeep Singh Gill, alias Arsh Dalla, the de facto chief of the banned Khalistan Tiger Force, amid India's push for his extradition.
summary: A Canadian court has granted bail to Khalistani terrorist Arshdeep Singh Gill, alias Arsh Dalla, the de facto chief of the banned Khalistan Tiger Force, amid India's push for his extradition.

title: Bryan Johnson Turns To Bollywood Songs To Explain Night-Time Erections
content: Mr Johnson has been transparent about using his night-time erections as a "biomarker" for cardiovascular and sexual health.
